intro: Silene chodatii var. chodatii, commonly known as the Chodat's campion, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters. The plant produces striking pink to purple flowers with five petals, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, adapted to reduce water loss in its dry habitat. Silene chodatii var. chodatii is often found in rocky soils and is an important component of desert ecosystems.
